sub_title: Manager Education Coordination Team at Utrecht University
summary:
In the past 25 years in higher education administration, at 7 different higher education institutes (both in The Netherlands and abroad), I have gained experience in many aspects of higher education administration. 

I am, however, always eager to learn more, to broaden my horizons and to apply my experience in new surroundings.

I think on my feet, am able to quickly grasp the most important points of the issue at hand, and can zoom in from a helicopter point of view to more detailed levels.

My main interests within higher education are: quality assurance, internationalization, translating national laws and rules and university regulations to manageable policies and procedures on the shop floor, and the daily contact with students and staff from all over the world.

school.name: Amsterdamse Academie voor Bank en Financiën

authors.headline: Manager Education Coordination Team at Utrecht University

profile_positions.description:
As the right-hand woman of the Director of Education, I make sure the university's and faculty's educational policy is executed within the Department of Sustainable Development. I am the manager of two education coordinators. Member of both the Bachelor and Master Education Management Team. Some of my focus areas are: quality assurance (e.g. accreditations); assessment plans; scheduling in  corona-times; translating faculty policy into procedures and rules and communicating them; contact person for educational affairs between faculty and department; noticing and solving problems in educational programmes and regulations; first point of call for lecturers about education administration and regulations; internship coordination; selection of (international) master students; (re)writing course guides.

Projects I have been or am still involved in:
- member projectteam quality assurance at CHARM-EU (www.charm-eu.eu) (ongoing)
- member projectteam review Master Sustainable Development (ongoing)
- reviewing the education support organisation at the Faculty of Geosciences
- member projectteam educational communication lecturers

Products and results: 
- report educational communication for the Faculty Board
- new structure of the education support organisation at the Faculty of Geosciences
- successful Assessment New Degree ("Toets Nieuwe Opleiding") for a master's programme
profile_positions.title: Manager Education Coordination Team

profile_positions.description:
Since June 2009, I work for the Department of Sustainable Development (previously Innovation, Environmental and Energy Sciences), Faculty of Geosciences. Tasks and activities include (a.o.): Quality assurance (from individual course evaluations to accreditation processes for entire degrees); coordinating Board of Examiners, Education Committees and Management Teams; calculating financial implications of education; internships coordination; writing course guides; setting up and communicating rules and regulations; coordination of graduation ceremonies; first point of contact for lecturers regarding education administration; point of contact for students mostly regarding regulations and Board of Examiners; organising introductory meetings for Joint Degree Master's students; involvement in selection process of Bachelor's and  Master's students. Since 2016, I manage two members of staff.

Projects I have been (or am still) involved with are:
- coordination of five re-accreditation processes (all successfully completed)
- setting up two new Master's programmes 
- setting up a new Bachelor's programme
- setting up a Faculty-wide internships database (web-based)
- setting up a new students' website
- renewal of a Master's programme
- developing a policy regarding transfer of grades and credits earned abroad

Products and results:
- successful re-accreditation of five degree programmes
- successful start of a new BSc programme (150+ students in year 1)
- handbook for lecturers regarding administrative issues of teaching courses at the Deprtament of Sustainable Development (incl. yearly updates)
- two alumni survey reports (2012 and 2015)
- yearly course guides for 4 Bachelor's programmes and 5 Master's programmes
- web-based internships database
- university wide policy on transferring grades and credits from abroad
profile_positions.title: Education Coordinator (Onderwijscoördinator)

profile_positions.description:
At Nyenrode Business Universiteit I worked for the Part-time MSc in Management. Students with demanding full-time jobs, studied for their MSc degree in the weekends and expected excellent education and service. 

In general I supported, facilitated and coordinated the education process. Specific tasks included: quality assurance, organising graduation ceremonies and the introduction day for new students, scheduling courses, administration of grades, updating the website (Sharepoint), being the first point of contact for students and staff, coordinating booksales, re-writing the information booklet for new students, offering course material and case studies, attending information sessions and other general education administration business.
I also trained a new member of staff. 

Products and results: 
- monthly planning for the entire year which made the tasks easier to plan and organise 
- up to date information booklet
profile_positions.title: Program Coordinator

profile_positions.description: In this job, I worked for the department of Roman languages, Faculty of Humanities. I scheduled courses, organised graduation ceremonies and "meeloopdagen"​ ("study for a day"-days for pupils in secondary school), wrote course guides, updates websites and I was secretary to the Board of Examiners and first port of call for students and lecturers.
profile_positions.title: Co-worker Education Administration
Registrar

profile_positions.description:
HR Assistant at the Faculty of Humanities
I worked at Leiden University whilst studying for an MA at the University of Amsterdam. 

Tasks included: assisting with recruitment and selection of both scientific and support staff; making an inventory of the additional functions of the scientific staff; recording the wishes of staff regarding new ADV regulations; calculating the number of holidays a member of staff is entitled to; all other general administrative tasks.

Projects and results:
- Additional functions of the scientific staff. I set up and successfully concluded this project almost completely singlehandedly;
- the entire ADV regulations of the Faculty of Humanities have been recorded.
profile_positions.title: HR Assistant (Assistent Personeelszaken)

profile_positions.description:
At Napier University, Edinburgh, I worked as a student records assistant, in a team of 4 people.

Tasks included: student registration and administration; making an inventory of the database; issuing statistical data and references; administration of student loans. 

Dealing with students from abroad (both exchange students and degree students) was my particular responsibility.
profile_positions.title: Student records assistant (medewerker studentenadministratie)

company.name: Standard Life and Amsterdamse Hogeschool voor de Kunsten

profile_positions.company: Standard Life and Amsterdamse Hogeschool voor de Kunsten
profile_positions.description:
Oct 96-Feb 97: Standard Life Assurance Company, Edinburgh. Co-worker financial administration. Financial administration regarding property investments. 

Sep 94-Jul 95: Hogeschool voor de kunsten, Amsterdam. Co-worker financial administration and student records office. Taking care of student administration from registration to graduation; advising students; developing procedures; miscellaneous tasks regarding financing of education and the merger with Sweelinck Conservatorium; making statistics; assisting with yearly accounts and audits. At the finance department I worked as a bookkeeper and assisted in preparing the annual report.  

Nov 92-Sep 93: Hogeschool voor de kunsten, Amsterdam. Receptionist and librarian/mailroom worker. Reading incoming mail, inputting relevant information about the mail into a database and distributing mail to the correct people; miscellaneous library activities. As a result, mail was easier to retrieve due to a more logical input into the database. I worked mainly without any supervision.
profile_positions.title: Several jobs within financial administration and student records
